What is the purpose of the `getreceivedbyaccount` command in Verus, and how does it work?

The `getreceivedbyaccount` command in Verus is used to retrieve the total amount of VRSC received by a specific account. This command is deprecated, which means it is no longer recommended for use and may be removed in future versions of Verus.

The command takes two arguments:

1. "account" (string, required): This must be set to an empty string (`""`)) to represent the default account. Passing any other string will result in an error.
2. minconf (numeric, optional, default=1): This specifies the minimum number of confirmations required for transactions to be included in the calculation.

The result of the command is the total amount of VRSC received by the specified account, with the specified minimum number of confirmations.

Here are some examples of how to use the `getreceivedbyaccount` command:

* To get the amount received by the default account with at least 1 confirmation: `verus getreceivedbyaccount ""`
* To get the amount received by the "tabby" account, including unconfirmed amounts with zero confirmations: `verus getreceivedbyaccount "tabby" 0`
* To get the amount received by the "tabby" account with at least 6 confirmations: `verus getreceivedbyaccount "tabby" 6`

The command can also be used as a JSON RPC call, as shown in the example:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getreceivedbyaccount", "params": ["tabby", 6] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
Note that the `getreceivedbyaccount` command is deprecated and may be removed in future versions of Verus. It is recommended to use alternative commands or methods to achieve the same result.

getreceivedbyaccount "account" ( minconf )

DEPRECATED. Returns the total amount received by addresses with <account> in transactions with at least [minconf] confirmations.

Arguments:
1. "account"   (string, required) MUST be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. Passing any other string will result in an error.
2. minconf     (numeric, optional, default=1) Only include transactions confirmed at least this many times.

Result:
amount       (numeric) The total amount in VRSC received for this account.

Examples:

Amount received by the default account with at least 1 confirmation
> verus getreceivedbyaccount ""

Amount received at the tabby account including unconfirmed amounts with zero confirmations
> verus getreceivedbyaccount "tabby" 0

The amount with at least 6 confirmation, very safe
> verus getreceivedbyaccount "tabby" 6

As a json rpc call
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getreceivedbyaccount", "params": ["tabby", 6] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
